definition: common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
European Community, old term for EU, European Union 歐盟|欧盟[Ou1 meng2]
common program/formal program of the communist party after 1949, that served as interim national plan

pinyin: gong4 tong2 zha2 dao4 jie4 mian4

definition: European common market (old term for EU, European Union)
pinyin: Ou1 zhou1 gong4 tong2 shi4 chang3

sentences.english: Prime Minister Ted Heath takes Britain into the European Community
sentences.chinese: 1973年希思首相把英國帶入歐洲共同體。

sentences.english: China stands ready to earnestly implement the agreement together with Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 中方願與越方共同努力，認真落實協議。

sentences.english: Safety measures co-evolve with the development of the technology.
sentences.chinese: 安全措施與技術的發展共同演化。

sentences.english: we start reflecting on that as a way to collaborate.
sentences.chinese: 我們找到了一種共同點。

sentences.english: Interest group comes from some people's maintenance of common interests.
sentences.chinese: 利益集團來自於部分人對共同利益的維護。

sentences.english: J. Simpson's codefendants were in a Las Vegas court today.
sentences.chinese: 辛普森的共同被告今日走上拉斯維加斯法庭。

sentences.english: We sincerely hope of fully cooper-ate with old and new cutomers. to achieve mutual progress.
sentences.chinese: 同時誠望與各新老客戶通力合作，共同拓展。

sentences.english: The percentage of soil moisture content and surface residual coverage jointly influence the quantity of wind erosion.
sentences.chinese: 土壤含水率和地表殘茬覆蓋共同影響着土壤的風蝕量。

sentences.english: The estimated six to seven thousand languages spoken around the globe are the repository of our collective memory and intangible heritage.
sentences.chinese: 這六七千種語言承載者我們共同的回憶和非物質遺產。

sentences.english: In joint offense has transitional form of crimes, also exists surplus behavior.
sentences.chinese: 共同犯罪中既存在轉化犯，也存在過限問題。

sentences.english: Following that, the two heads of state jointly met with journalists from the media of China, Chile and other countries.
sentences.chinese: 隨後兩國元首共同會見了中智兩國和國際傳媒記者。

sentences.english: The Dunnings have a wealth of stories from the time they spent with Jackson.
sentences.chinese: 鄧寧斯有一段與傑克遜共同度過的寶貴的人生經歷。

sentences.english: However, Taobao also have a common vision off Amoy, Taobao is indeed a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 但是淘寶也要有淘客共同的目光，淘寶的確很賺錢。

sentences.english: Dear Colleagues, It gives me great pleasure to co-chair the third round of the China-US Economic Dialogue together with Secretary Geithner.
sentences.chinese: 我很高興與蓋特納財長共同主持第三輪中美經濟對話。

sentences.english: There- fore, there is much room for further rethinking of the common behavior theory in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 因此，日本行爲共同說是值得反思的。
共同創造把人們都吸引了進去。

definition: hand in hand/to join hands/to collaborate
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
lit. to join hands/to act together
to cooperate/to collaborate/to work together/cooperation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to lead (an animal by the head)/to take the lead/to coordinate (a combined operation)/to mediate/a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
to have as its purpose/to be intended to/to aim to (do sth)
to join forces/to give full cooperation
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
